a moveable bar or rod attached to the door, which fastens the door to its frame when closed.
a message transmitted by telegraph; telegram.
ತಾರು ಕೊಡು tāru koḍu = ತಾರು ಮಾಡು; ತಾರು ಮಾಡು tāru māḍu to send a message by telegraph; to telegraph.
a thick, sticky, brown to black liquid with a pungent odour, obtained by the destructive distillation of wood, coal, peat, shale, etc. used mainly in making road surfaces; tar.
a condition lacking order; a confused state of an affair.
the things, conditions, influences, etc. that surround a given place or person; environment.
= ತಾರ್ಗೂಡು.
the state or quality of being young, characterised by vigour, liveliness, immaturity, impetuosity, etc.
a female person between girlhood and womanhood.
an assemblage of large number of persons at a place.
lack of order, tidiness or system; disorderliness.
the condition characterised by lack of harmony, agreement, fitness or appropriateness; incongruity; absurdity.
a confused, muddled up state; embroilment.
without having any order; in a messy manner.
an apparatus or system that converts a coded message into electric impulses and sends it to a distant receiver; the telegraph instrument.
the large deciduous tree Terminalia belerica (= T. bellirica, = T. bellerica) of Combretaceae family.
any of the heavenly bodies, except planets and satellites, appearing as fixed luminous points in the sky at night; a star.
the expanding and contracting opening in the iris of the eye, through which light passes to the retina; the pupil of the eye.

a smooth, rounded bead formed within the shells of certain molluscs and composed of the mineral aragonite or calcite in a matrix, deposited in concentric layers as a protective coating around an irritating foreign object, valued as a gem when lustrous and finely coloured; a pearl.
a necklace sewn with a pearl or pearls.
(myth.) name of the wife of Břhaspati, the preceptor of gods.
the air or wind.
a person who is celebrated or distinguished in the cinema or theatre; a star.
silver.
a kind of folk song.
to speak or shout in a shrill voice.
to sing in a shrill voice or higher octave.
= ತಾರ್ಕಣಿಸು.
to make more certain the validity of; to confirm; to corroborate.
the act of perusing, examining, scrutinising or corroborating personally; corroboration.
anything serving or tending to establish the truth of something or to convince one of its truth; a conclusive evidence or proof.
something selected to show the nature or character of the rest; an example.
the condition or quality of being in harmonious agreement, association.
the act or fact of noticing or perceiving.
= ತಾರ್ಕಾಣ್.
to provide proof, justification, support to prove (something).
= ತಾರ್ಕಣೆ.
